de.wwu.muggl.symbolic.flow.coverage
Class CoverageController

java.lang.Object
  de.wwu.muggl.symbolic.flow.coverage.CoverageController

public class CoverageController
extends java.lang.Object

This Class is the topmost controller for any control-flow and data-flow generation and coverage tracking.

While it is possible to use some of the structures independently, this controller should be used to access them. It will generate full control-flow and data-flow structures starting with an initial method and it offers auxiliary functions to keep track of the coverage.

Version:
1.0.0, 2010-08-28
Author:
Tim Majchrzak

Method Detail

updateCoverage

public void updateCoverage(Method method,
                           int pc)
                    throws InitializationException
Update the coverage according to the instruction number.

Parameters:
method - The method currently executed.
pc - The current pc of the virtual machine.
Throws:
InitializationException - In cases of non-recoverable initialization exceptions.

markCFInvocationFinished

public boolean markCFInvocationFinished(Method method)
Update the control graph is execution of a method was finished normally by setting -2. Control graph edges from exceptions are covered by the exception handler and do not need to be treated by this method. If finished, return the information whether full coverage of the method is now reached.

Parameters:
method - The method currently executed.
Returns:
true, if full control flow coverage is now reached for the method; false otherwise.

shallStopExecution

public boolean shallStopExecution(Method method)
Check whether execution should be stopped with regard to the fulfillment of the coverage criteria.

Parameters:
method - The method currently executed.
Returns:
true, if executed should be stopped.

getWhatIsCovered

public java.lang.String getWhatIsCovered()
Return a String representation of what has been covered. This information is set when shallStopExecution(Method) is executed and returns true.

Watch out: This method is not thread-safe. If #shallStopExecution(Method) is accessed again before execution of this method is finished, the returned result will be arbitrary.

Returns:
Return a String representation of what has been covered; or null, if no such information has been set, yet.

isEverythingCovered

public boolean[] isEverythingCovered(Method method)
Check if every every control graph edge and def-use chain is covered. Control flow coverage is tracked on a per-method level.

Parameters:
method - The method currently executed.
Returns:
a boolean array with two dimensions; the first ones shows control graph coverage, the second one shows def-use coverage.

commitAllchanges

public void commitAllchanges()
Commit the coverage of control-flow edges and def-use chains as a new solution was found.

getCFCoverageMap

public java.util.Map<Method,boolean[]> getCFCoverageMap()
Get the mapping of methods to control flow coverage. Coverage is represented by an array of boolean values indicating which control graph edges are currently covered. A value of true indicates that the corresponding edge is covered.

Returns:
A mapping of methods to control flow coverage.

getCGCoverageMap

public java.util.Map<Method,CGCoverage> getCGCoverageMap()
Get the map of Method to CGCoverage instances.

Returns:
The mapping of methods to control flow coverage objects.

getDUCoverage

public DUCoverage getDUCoverage()
Get the DUCoverage instance of the coverage controller.

Returns:
The def-use chains coverage object.

getDUCoverageAsBoolean

public boolean[] getDUCoverageAsBoolean()
Get an array of boolean values indicating which def-use chains have been covered. A value of true indicates that the corresponding def-use chain is covered.

Returns:
An array of boolean values indicating which def-use chains have been covered.

reportFrameChange

public void reportFrameChange(Frame frame)
Report a frame change. This is important for the control flow coverage since the method of the frame has to be covered (if it is newly entered). The value of the last pc of the covered method will be reverted to -1 indicating that the next step is the execution of the method's first instruction.

Parameters:
frame - The frame that will now be executed in the virtual machine.

revertPcTo

public void revertPcTo(Method method,
                       int pc)
Revert the pc for the specified method to the specified value.

In general, this method is to be used to report a return from an invoked method. This requires the last pc value of the invoking method to be reverted in order to reflect the transition that will happen when execution continues. Alternatively, recovering a state in a depth first search requires the pc to be reverted.

Parameters:
method - The method currently executed.
pc - The pc to revert the last pc value to.

reportFailedHandling

public void reportFailedHandling(Method method)
Report that handling of an exception failed in a method. This will yield a transition of the last pc value and -3 which indicates abortion of method invocation due to an exception.

Parameters:
method - The method currently executed.
